p: Regression models also showed that 54~81% variances of CO 2 exchange were explained by temperature and light intensity under SW. Light intensity accounted for 52~79% variance of Pn and 49~80% variance of Pg. In general, the models had more predictive power for Pg than for Pn. For CO 2 exchange under E-NRW, temperature and light intensity accounted for 79~96% of the total variance, and 82~94% of the variances were explained by light intensity at low light (≤10 μmol m −2 s −1). At higher light intensity (≥25 μmol m −2 s −1), temperature accounted for 48~84% variance of CO 2 exchange in the two ACs; but its explanatory powers for the other three types of biocrusts were lower, although the explanations for Pg (14~70%) were still significant (<0.0001).
